intro: Aeluropus micrantherus, commonly known as the small-flowered saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It is adapted to withstand high salinity and drought conditions, making it a valuable species for ecological restoration in coastal and desert regions. Its ability to thrive in harsh environments highlights its importance in stabilizing soil and supporting biodiversity in saline habitats.
